title: ReplacementRule
description: A text replacement rule for post-processing transcriptions. Rules can be literal (exact match) or regex patterns.

id.description: Unique identifier for this rule. For preset rules, prefixed with preset ID (e.g., 'punctuation:period').

enabled.description: Whether this rule is active. Disabled rules are skipped during processing.

kind.description: Rule type: 'literal' for exact text matching, 'regex' for regular expression patterns.

pattern.description: The pattern to match. For 'literal' kind, this is exact text. For 'regex' kind, this is a regular expression.

replacement.description: The replacement text. For 'regex' kind, can include capture group references (e.g., '\1', '\2').

word_boundary.description: If true (literal only), only match when pattern is surrounded by word boundaries. Prevents partial matches within words.

case_sensitive.description: If true, pattern matching is case-sensitive. If false, matches regardless of case.

description.description: Optional human-readable description of what this rule does.

origin.description: Origin of this rule: 'user' for user-created rules, 'preset' for rules from preset packs.
